snippet.title: Fiji sevens coach keen to build the core strength of his squad
snippet.content: The countdown has begun ahead of another big year for Fiji's national rugby sevens squad, with the World Series to be followed by the Commonwealth Games and the World Cup. Big changes are looming for the squad with captain Osea Kolinisau set to depart for pastures new in the United States, while long time Pacific sprint king, Banuve Tabakaucoro, is on the radar and making strides in his new sport. Right now, coach Gareth Baber says the focus is on strength building because when the season starts, he wants to combine Fijian flare with combat readiness.
